headline: Pershing Square buys Hertz, Amazon and Meta, exits Hilton and Nike
summary: In Pershing Square’s annual investor presentation, the firm announced new positions in Hertz (HTZ), Amazon.com (AMZN) and Meta Platforms (META). In 2025, Pershing said it exited positions in Chipotle (CMG), Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CP) and Nike (NKE). It exited Hilton (HLT) shares in 2026. headline: Hyatt Q4 Earnings Beat, Revenues Lag Estimates, Stock Down
summary: H's fourth-quarter 2025 results reflect higher RevPAR, rising fees and a strong development pipeline signal steady growth momentum.

headline: Mizuho Maintains Neutral on Hilton Worldwide Holdings, Raises Price Target to $321
summary: Mizuho  analyst Ben Chaiken   maintains Hilton Worldwide Holdings (NYSE:HLT) with a Neutral and raises the price target from $266 to $321.

headline: Wells Fargo Maintains Overweight on Hilton Worldwide Holdings, Raises Price Target to $373
summary: Wells Fargo  analyst Trey Bowers   maintains Hilton Worldwide Holdings (NYSE:HLT) with a Overweight and raises the price target from $338 to $373.

headline: HLT Q4 Deep Dive: Strong International Growth, New Brands, and Cautious U.S. Outlook
summary: Hotel company Hilton (NYSE:HLT) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 10.9% year on year to $3.09 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.08 per share was 3.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
